Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): remove classes in .d.ts files from provider checks
Issues.Body:
This commit temporarily excludes classes declared in .d.ts files from checks
regarding whether providers are actually injectable.

Such classes used to be ignored (on accident) because the
`TypeScriptReflectionHost.getConstructorParameters()` method did not return
constructor parameters from d.ts files, mostly as an oversight. This was
recently fixed, but caused more providers to be exposed to this check, which
created a breakage in g3.

This commit temporarily fixes the breakage by continuing to exclude such
providers from the check, until g3 can be patched.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(compiler-cli): remove classes in .d.ts files from provider checks" (#40118)

Issues.Title: fix(core): Call `onDestroy` in production mode as well
Issues.Body:
PR #39876 introduced an error where the `onDestroy` of `ComponentRef` would only get called if `ngDevMode` was set to true. This was because in dev mode we would freeze `TCleanup` to verify that no more static cleanup would get added to `TCleanup` array. This ensured that `TCleanup` was always present in dev mode. In production the `TCleanup` would get created only when needed. The resulting cleanup code was incorrectly indented and would only run if `TCleanup` was present causing this issue.

Fix #40105

Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): emit `forwardRef` invocation for forward type references
Issues.Body:
The types of directives and pipes that are used in a component's
template may be emitted into the partial declaration wrapped inside a
closure, which is needed when the type is declared later in the module.
This poses a problem for JIT compilation of partial declarations, as
this closure is indistinguishable from a class reference itself. To mark
the forward reference function as such, this commit changes the partial
declaration codegen to emit a `forwardRef` invocation wrapped around
the closure, which ensures that the closure is properly tagged as a
forward reference. This allows the forward reference to be treated as
such during JIT compilation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(compiler-cli): emit `forwardRef` invocation for forward type references" (#40117)

Issues.Title: ci: reduce flakiness of docs-infra `deploy-to-firebase.js` tests
Issues.Body:
The `deploy-to-firebase.js` tests rely on git info retrieved from the `angular/angular` repository (via `git ls-remote ...`).

Previously, different calls to `git ls-remote` could return different values if a new commit was pushed or a new branch was created during test execution, resulting in errors ([example CI failure][1]).

This commit makes the tests more stable by memoizing the result of `git ls-remote` and returning the same result for subsequent calls with the same arguments (even if meanwhile the remote has been updated).

[1]: https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/877626
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: reduce flakiness of docs-infra `deploy-to-firebase.js` tests" (#40088)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): force compileNonExportedClasses: false in LS
Issues.Body:
Projects opened in the LS are often larger in scope than the compilation
units seen by the compiler when actually building. For example, in the LS
it's not uncommon for the project to include both application as well as
test files. This can create issues when the combination of files results
in errors that are not otherwise present - for example, if test files
have inline NgModules that re-declare components (a common Angular pattern).
Such code is valid when compiling the app only (test files are excluded, so
only one declaration is seen by the compiler) or when compiling tests only
(since tests run in JIT mode and are not seen by the AOT compiler), but when
both sets of files are mixed into a single compilation unit, the compiler
sees the double declaration as an error.

This commit attempts to mitigate the problem by forcing the compiler flag
`compileNonExportedClasses` to `false` in a LS context. When tests contain
duplicate declarations, often such declarations are inline in specs and not
exported from the top level, so this flag can be used to greatly improve the
IDE experience.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(language-service): force compileNonExportedClasses: false in LS" (#40092)

Issues.Title: Angular elements can't inherit hierarchical dependencies
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package * @angular/elements@11.0.4 (latest version as of now) ### Is this a regression? No ### Description First off I'd like to acknowledge that yes this is a possible duplicate of [this issue](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24824). However, the suggested workaround no longer works (I'm not sure if it did at the time). Since the original issue has been closed and conversation has been locked, opening a new issue seemed to be the only way to address it. **The short version** Hierarchical providers do not work when using Angular elements. **The long version** When using Angular elements, hierarchical providers do not work. The child element will always only have itself and the root as its providers. The suggested workaround is the [following comment](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24824#issuecomment-404399564): > you could implement a custom strategy (see: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/elements/src/element-strategy.ts#L27-L44) -that walked up the DOM to grab the parent element/injector before constructing the child component, but in general you should avoid depending on hierarchical DI for Elements. However, this workaround does not seem to work. I've implemented the workaround, fetching the parent injector at runtime and passing it as the parent injector for the newly created element instance's injector. The end result is the `NgElementStrategyFactory` being created with an injector that has the DOM parent as the injector parent (as it should). This injector is then passed to `NgElementStrategyFactory.create`, after which a new injector function is created. This is then finally passed to the `lView` creator function. The problem that occurs at runtime however, is that the function that actually fetches dependencies does not go up this tree. This function ([getOrCreateInjectable](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/2b74a05a6539b78ed6682e29d4c3b5a6052a9cdd/packages/core/src/render3/di.ts#L411)) instead searches the current injector by using the bloom system. Since the dependency has never been registered as a provided value by the given component, it is not registered on the bloom system. This function then skips this level and tries to go up to the parent. Importantly however, it does not go up this tree by using `injector.parent`, but instead looks up the parent in the `lView`. However, because the component was created as a root component with no parent ([through `ComponentFactory.create`](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/7ea5161d4d0570150b0315adeac44e27387f48ea/packages/core/src/render3/component_ref.ts#L98)), this fails. The `lView` has no parent, which means the check for dependency injection stops at this level and the search for the DI value fails. I'm wondering if there is another workaround for this issue. I tried creating a new `ComponentFactory`, by creating a new `ComponentFactoryResolver`, by creating a new `NgElementStrategyFactory`, however this fails as well. I wanted to override the `ComponentFactory.create` method but there are just too many private methods to be able to re-create the original function (and making some modifications afterwards of course). If there were a few values that I'd have to copy that would be fine, but some functions are simply not accessible and can not be copied (I'm mostly talking about `lView` context etc here). I'd be fine with the answer being: > This is works as intended (or more accurately, this is not possible with Elements) However, I'd say if something is supported in the normal Angular version, it should at least have a workaround that makes it possible in Angular Elements. As a side note, I'm also wondering what the reasoning behind this is: > but in general you should avoid depending on hierarchical DI for Elements I'm sure there's valid reasoning behind it but I couldn't find an explanation anywhere. **Possible fix** In the best case of course, this would be made possible in Angular Elements out-of-the-box. However, taking into account that this is not supported on purpose, I think the following would be more realistic. Allowing the `ComponentFactory.create` function to have an optional `parent` parameter, which is then set as the parent of the `lView` would be the biggest requirement for this workaround to be possible. Of course there would have to be a few other changes in that function, where it is assumed that this is a root component. A custom element strategy can then be used (as suggested in the original issue's reply), which would allow the hierarchical dependency injection to work again. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-3jpm5a?file=src/app/app.module.ts) [github repo](https://github.com/SanderRonde/angular-elements-bug) ## 🔥 Exception or Error 
ERROR NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(AppModule)[InjectorService -> InjectorService -> InjectorService]: 
  NullInjectorError: No provider for InjectorService!
## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.7
Node: 14.15.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 10.0.9
... animations, common, compiler, core, elements, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.10.7
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.10.7
@angular-devkit/core              9.0.0-rc.7
@angular-devkit/schematics        9.0.0-rc.7
@angular/cli                      9.0.0-rc.7
@angular/compiler-cli             9.0.0-rc.7
@angular/language-service         7.0.4
@ngtools/webpack                  7.0.7
@schematics/angular               9.0.0-rc.7
@schematics/update                0.900.0-rc.7
rxjs                              6.6.2
typescript                        3.1.6
webpack                           4.19.1
Note that this bug also occurs on the latest version (11.0.4 as of now) **Anything else relevant?** Nope, this error occurs regardless of environment.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular elements can't inherit hierarchical dependencies" (#40104)

Issues.Title: fix(core): ensure sanitizer works if DOMParser return null body
Issues.Body:
In some browsers, notably a mobile version of webkit on iPad, the
result of calling `DOMParser.parseFromString()` returns a document
whose `body` property is null until the next tick of the browser.
Since this is of no use to us for sanitization, we now fall back to the
"inert document" strategy for this case.

Fixes #39834
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): ensure sanitizer works if DOMParser return null body" (#40107)

If i do not turn on translation it is giving me correct response for API However when i turn on translation i am getting this error. `InvalidAccessError The object does not support the operation or argument` Error is happening only when i do translation from browser if i do translation from settings in Iphone the it is working fine. and it is also working fine in all browsers in laptop. If use javascript fetch function instead of angular HttpClient then it is working fine with HttpClient request is not even going to server. It is giving error even before sending request. I tried to reproduce same issue in stackblitz but if i create any app on stackblitz than translate button is disabled there. You can see this stackblitz app created by me - https://angular-9-starter-gf561h.stackblitz.io/ ![translate-screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67366916/102060311-06411d80-3e18-11eb-9fb1-b4348a5d90e9.jpg) You can see in stackblitz this `trnaslate` option in dislabled. but it is enabled in my local app. And once i click on that button than httpClient stops working To Regenerate issue 1) Install latest angular app 2) add any httpClient service in app 3) run app and open in. Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): JIT compilation of directive declarations
Issues.Body:
The `ɵɵngDeclareDirective` calls are designed to be translated to fully
AOT compiled code during a build transform, but in cases this is not
done it is still possible to compile the declaration object in the
browser using the JIT compiler. This commit adds a runtime
implementation of `ɵɵngDeclareDirective` which invokes the JIT compiler
using the declaration object, such that a compiled directive definition
is made available to the Ivy runtime.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(compiler-cli): JIT compilation of directive declarations" (#40101)

Issues.Title: fix(core): `QueryList` does not fire changes if the underlying list did not change.
Issues.Body:
Previous implementation would fire changes `QueryList.changes.subscribe`
even if underlying list did not change. Such situation can arise if a
`LView` is inserted or removed, causing `QueryList` to recompute, but
the recompute results in the same exact `QueryList` result. In such
a case we don't want to fire a change event (as there is no change.)

Issues.Title: Router shallowEqual util throws error in IE
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I can't get this to reproduce locally, but our logs show that users using IE and Edge are getting an error message of "Object expected" on line [29 of collection.ts](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/router/src/utils/collection.ts#L29). This indicates that the second object being passed into the shallowEqual is not an object. The call is coming from [updateSegmentGroup](https://source.corp.google.com/piper///depot/google3/third_party/javascript/angular2/rc/packages/router/src/create_url_tree.ts;l=197?q=updateSegmentGroupChildren&ct=os&sq=package:piper%20file:%2F%2Fdepot%2Fgoogle3%20-file:google3%2Fexperimental) which calls prefixedWith which calls shallowEqual. It seems like additional checks in compare to ensure that the two objects being passed to shallowEqual are in fact objects should resolve this issue. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction The errors are from logs so I don't have a reliable way to reproduce the issue, but we are seeing many reports of this error. ## 🔥 Exception or Error 



Object expected
## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** We run with the latest version of Angular. The errors from today were probably cut from an Angular version a week or two ago. **Anything else relevant?** This only occurs in Edge and IE as far as we can tell.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Router shallowEqual util throws error in IE" (#40090)

Issues.Title: Support children outlet in wildcard route
Issues.Body: I'm trying to make the following route config work: ```javascript { path: '**', component: PageComponent, children: [ { path: ':slug', outlet: 'section', component: SectionComponent } ] }, ``` And this in the `PageComponent`: ```html Section One ``` As of Angular 11, the outlet doesn't work under a wildcard. Using `routerLink` in `PageComponent` generates the proper link, but it doesn't navigate anywhere when clicked, meaning the URL doesn't change, and the router-outlet doesn't get populated. The idea is to have a route with unlimited dynamic nested pages where each page can have a section outlet, like: `/:page/[:page]/(section:[:slug])` Could this be supported? Is there any workaround I can use?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support children outlet in wildcard route" (#40089)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): express trusted constants with tagged template literals
Issues.Body:
The trustConstantHtml and trustConstantResourceUrl functions are only
meant to be passed constant strings extracted from Angular application
templates, as passing other strings or variables could introduce XSS
vulnerabilities.

To better protect these APIs, turn them into template tags. This makes
it possible to assert that the associated template literals do not
contain any interpolation, and thus must be constant.

Issues.Title: Vulnerability problem due to outdated dependency
Issues.Body:
A recent scan found a new vulnerability caused by an outdated dependency. The problem may cause data pollution and it has been ranked [High severity by the CVV](https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-7774#vulnCurrentDescriptionTitle).

This is the dependency tree with a problem.
 
| package     | used version | current version |
| ----------- | ------------ | --------------- |
| y18n        | 4.0.0        | 5.0.5           |
| cacache     | 12.0.4       | 15.0.5          |
| pacote      | 9.5.12       | 11.1.13         |
| angular/cli | 11.0.4      | 11.0.4          |

That is, angular/cli uses Pacote 9, which uses Cacache 12 which uses y18n 4. The latter one is where the vulnerability exists.

If angular/cli updates their dependency to request Pacote11, Cacache 15 does not even use y18n as dependency so the problem will be solved for good.

As per the [guidelines](https://angular.io/guide/security#report-issues), an email has been sent to security@angular.io and this issue is created to track its resolution.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Vulnerability problem due to outdated dependency" (#19624)

Issues.Title: Exported scss variables are undefined in typescript
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description I'm trying to reuse scss variables also in typescript code of the components, but they don't get imported as I'd expect. Following some [tutorials](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40418804/access-sass-values-colors-from-variables-scss-in-typescript-angular2-ionic2) it should be able this way: - in styles.scss: `$color: "red";` `:export { color: $color; }` - in styles.scss.d.ts: `export interface Styles { color: string; }` `export const styles: Styles;` `export default styles;` - in app.component.ts: `import styles from "../styles.scss";` When I log `styles.color`, it should say 'red', but it's `undefined`. However, logging the whole `styles` variable logs the whole scss :export rule in a form of a string: `:export{color:"red"}` ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Open [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cli-11-scss-export?file=src%2Fstyles.scss) and read what console says. ## 🌍 Your Environment

Issues.Title: angular.json fileReplacements no longer accept folder path replacements in Angular 11
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [X] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 10.0.1 ### Description I'm using fileReplacements config in order to replace an entire folder content. This used to work well using v10.0.1 In version 11.0.3 it isn't working anymore. It will give me the following lint warning: ```String does not match the pattern of "\.(([cm]?j|t)sx?|json)$".``` And when trying to build a prod version it is giving the following error: ``` Schema validation failed with the following errors: Data path ".fileReplacements[1]" should NOT have additional properties(replace). Data path ".fileReplacements[1].replace" should match pattern "\.(([cm]?j|t)sx?|json)$". Data path ".fileReplacements[1]" should match exactly one schema in oneOf. ``` ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction 1. Add a path to folder in `replace` and `with` configs like this: ``` "configurations": { "prod": { "fileReplacements": [ { "replace": "node_modules/moment/locale/", "with": "src/moment-js-locale/" } ], } } ``` 2. run command ```ng build --prod``` ## 🔥 Exception or Error

  Data path ".fileReplacements[1].replace" should match pattern "\.(([cm]?j|t)sx?|json)$".
  Data path ".fileReplacements[1]" should match exactly one schema in oneOf.

Issues.Title: Angular build no longer compiles nested scss while serve does
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: I added new components and I wanted to build it as usual but it does not works as expected. I noticed _@angular-devkit/build-angular_ was updated from ^0.1001.0 to ^0.1100.3 but even when I downgrade it nothing changes. ### Description As explained I added new components and I tested them with _ng serve_ (npm run start cfr. stackblitz) and all the nested scss were successfully compiled. Then I ran a new build (npm run build-i18n cfr. stackblitz) but unlike before and the serve, the nested scss were not compiled (they are not present in the browser developer console). ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Please find as a minimal reproduction a [StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-a4bwgr) which works (StackBlitz logically uses serve?). ## 🌍 Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 10.2.0
Node: 12.18.3
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 10.1.0
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.1001.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.1100.4
@angular-devkit/core               10.1.0
@angular-devkit/schematics         10.2.0
@angular/cdk                       10.2.0
@angular/cli                       10.2.0
@angular/flex-layout               10.0.0-beta.32
@angular/material                  10.2.0
@angular/material-moment-adapter   10.2.0
@nguniversal/builders              10.1.0
@nguniversal/express-engine        10.1.0
@schematics/angular                10.2.0
@schematics/update                 0.1002.0
rxjs                               6.6.3
typescript                         4.0.2
webpack                            4.44.1
I hope to be clear enough otherwise tell me ;) Thank you!

[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence | |---|---|---|---|---|---| | [postcss](https://postcss.org/) ([source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss)) | [`8.1.10` -> `8.2.1`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/postcss/8.1.10/8.2.1) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/postcss/8.2.1/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/postcss/8.2.1/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/postcss/8.2.1/compatibility-slim/8.1.10)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/postcss/8.2.1/confidence-slim/8.1.10)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/postcss ### [`v8.2.1`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​821) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.2.0...8.2.1) - Fixed `Node#toJSON()` and `postcss.fromJSON()` (by Niklas Mischkulnig). ### [`v8.2.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/releases/8.2.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.14...8.2.0) PostCSS 8.2 added a new API to serialize and deserialize CSS AST to JSON. ```js import { parse, fromJSON } from 'postcss' let root = parse('a{}', { from: 'input.css' }) let json = root.toJSON() // save to file, send by network, etc let root2 = fromJSON(json) ``` Thanks to [@​mischnic](https://togithub.com/mischnic) for [his work](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1484). ### [`v8.1.14`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8114) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.13...8.1.14) - Fixed parser performance regression. ### [`v8.1.13`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8113) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.12...8.1.13) - Fixed broken AST after moving nodes in visitor API. ### [`v8.1.12`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8112) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.11...8.1.12) - Fixed Autoprefixer regression. ### [`v8.1.11`](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​8111) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/postcss/compare/8.1.10...8.1.11) - Added PostCSS update suggestion on unknown event in plugin.

Issues.Title: build: update autoprefixer to version 10.1.0
Issues.Body:
[![WhiteSource Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com) This PR contains the following updates: | Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence | |---|---|---|---|---|---| | [autoprefixer](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer) | [`10.0.4` -> `10.1.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/autoprefixer/10.0.4/10.1.0) | [![age](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/age-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/adoption-slim)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/compatibility-slim/10.0.4)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://badges.renovateapi.com/packages/npm/autoprefixer/10.1.0/confidence-slim/10.0.4)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | --- ### Release Notes
postcss/autoprefixer ### [`v10.1.0`](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/releases/10.1.0) [Compare Source](https://togithub.com/postcss/autoprefixer/compare/10.0.4...10.1.0) Autoprefixer 10.1 improved `min-resolution` support. [@​infusion](https://togithub.com/infusion) added `dpcm` unit support and `num2fraction` with [Fraction.js](https://togithub.com/infusion/Fraction.js/), which uses Farey Sequences as a rational approximation (more precise) and simplifies the fraction using continued fractions to ɛ <0.001 afterward. ```css /* input */ @​media (min-resolution: 113.38dpcm) { … } /* output */ @​media (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio: 3), (min--moz-device-pixel-ratio: 3), (-o-min-device-pixel-ratio: 3/1), (min-resolution: 113.38dpcm) { … } ```
--- ### Renovate configuration :date: **Schedule**: "after 10pm every weekday,before 4am every weekday,every weekend" in timezone America/Tijuana. :vertical_traffic_light: **Automerge**: Disabled by config. Issues.Title: ng build --prod=true fails with global scripts in agular.json when opt-in to Webpack 5
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? This works when not opting-in to Webpack 5. ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... --> If scripts are specified in the build options to be included globally, `ng build --prod=true` fails to build. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction 1. create a new angular project 2. opt-in to webpack 5 : `"resolutions": { "webpack": "5.4.0" }` 3. add an external dependency such as jquery to package.json (using yarn) `yarn add jquery` 4. update angular.json to include the new global dependency 

  "projects": {
    "wp5": {
      "projectType": "application",
      "schematics": {},
      "root": "",
      "sourceRoot": "src",
      "prefix": "app",
      "architect": {
        "build": {
          "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
          "options": {
            "outputPath": "dist/wp5",
            "index": "src/index.html",
            "main": "src/main.ts",
            "polyfills": "src/polyfills.ts",
            "tsConfig": "tsconfig.app.json",
            "aot": true,
            "assets": [
              "src/favicon.ico",
              "src/assets"
            ],
            "styles": [
              "src/styles.css"
            ],
            "scripts": [
              "./node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js"
            ]
          }
     ...
   }
5. run `ng build --prod=true` ## 🔥 Exception or Error 



wp5 % ng build --prod=true
✔ Browser application bundle generation complete.
An unhandled exception occurred: Chunk.modulesIterableThere was no ChunkGraph assigned to the Chunk for backward-compat (Use the new API)
See "/private/var/folders/km/qmp0wv016q9chrhmsr34qdp80000gn/T/ng-zRypdH/angular-errors.log" for further details.
## 🌍 Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 11.0.4
Node: 15.3.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.3
... animations, common, compiler, core, forms, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1101.0-next.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1101.0-next.2
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.4
@angular/cli                    11.0.4
@angular/compiler-cli           11.0.4
@schematics/angular             11.0.4
@schematics/update              0.1100.4
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.5
**Anything else relevant?**

### GitHub Vulnerability Alerts

#### [GHSA-qqgx-2p2h-9c37](https://togithub.com/npm/ini/commit/56d2805e07ccd94e2ba0984ac9240ff02d44b6f1)

### Overview
The `ini` npm package before version 1.3.6 has a Prototype Pollution vulnerability.

If an attacker submits a malicious INI file to an application that parses it with `ini.parse`, they will pollute the prototype on the application. This can be exploited further depending on the context.

### Patches

This has been patched in 1.3.6

### Steps to reproduce

payload.ini
```
[__proto__]
polluted = "polluted"
```

poc.js:
```
var fs = require('fs')
var ini = require('ini')

var parsed = ini.parse(fs.readFileSync('./payload.ini', 'utf-8'))
console.log(parsed)
console.log(parsed.__proto__)
console.log(polluted)
```

```
> node poc.js
{}
{ polluted: 'polluted' }
{ polluted: 'polluted' }
polluted
```

Issues.Title: bug(CdkOverlay): CdkOverlay incorrectly calculates viewport bounds
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-yh1yjm?file=src/app/example-component.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. Spawn a flexible position based overlay.
2. Make overlay contents height larger than viewport height such that overflow occurs.
3. Make viewport height a floating point number with decimal portion between .0 to .5.
4. The overlay will now overflow out of the viewport bounds.
5. Make the viewport height a floating point number between .5 to next whole number, or a whole number.
6. The overlay will now correctly stay within the viewport bounds.

Notes:
If you just try slowly resizing the window height while the overlay is open, you will see it bounce in and out of the viewport as the window height cycles between bad and good numbers.
 
Problem is that viewport height is a rounded number, and overlay height is a floating point. Therefore when viewport rounds down, the following check fails.

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/e436479a7bef69b87e8954616a9e29a265a1a2b1/src/cdk/overlay/position/flexible-connected-position-strategy.ts#L632

To compare the two numbers, the rounding needs to be consistent.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Flexible dimension overlay should always remain within viewport bounds.

#### Actual Behavior

Flexible dimension overlay does not remain within viewport bounds when viewport height rounds down.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.2.3
- CDK/Material: 10.2.7
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(CdkOverlay): CdkOverlay incorrectly calculates viewport bounds" (#21350)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-select): Support for selection through Alpha/Numeric keys broken
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

It seems that the support for skipping to a select item by typing, similar to the native select in MatSelect has been removed in recent updates. This support was added in https://github.com/angular/components/pull/2907

Steps to reproduce:

Open https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-a9vnec?file=src/app/select-custom-trigger-example.html

Set focus on the select list and quickly press few keys corresponding to a country name for example just type PAK, ideally it should set focus on Pakistan, but you will notice the focus is set to a new list item after each key press and you will end up selecting Kazakhstan from the list.
 
#### Expected Behavior

`mat-select` should support skipping to a select item by typing, a behavior similar to the native select.

It's really helpful especially in case of large lists.

#### Actual Behavior

Although pressing any key takes user to the first element of the list that starts with that key but quickly pressing subsequent key doesn't further filter the selection.

#### Environment

- Angular:11.0.3
- CDK/Material:11.0.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-select): Support for selection through Alpha/Numeric keys broken" (#21343)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-select): panel losing max-height if menu is opened after select
Issues.Body:
If an MDC-based `mat-menu` is opened after a `mat-select`, the select will lose its `max-height`, because its selector specificity is too low and it gets overwritten by the menu which uses the same set of mixins.

These changes resolve the issue by increasing the specificity.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-select): panel losing max-height if menu is opened after select" (#21341)

Issues.Title: fix(material/sort): animation not working correctly when activated on focus
Issues.Body:
The sort header arrow animation wasn't working correctly when it was triggered as a result of a focus/blur.
I'm marking this as a potential accessibility issue, because it prevents keyboard users from seeing what their potential sorted state would be.

Here's what it looks like at the moment:

* Fixes that the table data source wasn't unsubscribing from sorting, pagination etc. when it is disconnected.
* Adds a bit of logic to properly support re-connecting the same date source again.
* Fixes up a couple of issues in the unit test setup which could cause state to leak between tests.

Fixes #21270.

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/scrolling): virtual scroll not picking up trackBy function when items come in after init
Issues.Body:
The virtual scroll only creates its `IterableDiffer` once, which means that if the `trackBy` function comes in at a later point (e.g. the input changed or the initialization order is different), it won't be picked up.

These changes make it so the differ always has a `trackBy` which then delegates to the user-provided one or falls back to the default.

Fixes #21281.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/scrolling): virtual scroll not picking up trackBy function when items come in after init" (#21335)

Issues.Title: fix(material/slider): incorrectly inheriting color when nested inside component with theme
Issues.Body:
The slider theme selectors were a bit too broad which meant that it would automatically inherit the colors from a parent component, if the Material theming classes were used somewhere up the chain (e.g. a slider inside a tab group).

These changes use more specific selectors to avoid the issue.

Fixes #21271.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/slider): incorrectly inheriting color when nested inside component with theme" (#21334)
